02180                 float *bweight = CustomData_bmesh_get(&bm->vdata, eve->head.data, CD_BWEIGHT);
02181                 
02182                 VertsToTransData(t, tob, em, eve, bweight);
02183 
02184                 /* selected */
02185                 if (selstate[a]) tob->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
02186 
02187                 /* active */
02188                 if (eve == eve_act) tob->flag |= TD_ACTIVE;
02189 
02190                 if (propmode) {
02191                     if (propmode & T_PROP_CONNECTED) {
02192                         tob->dist = dists[a];
02193                     }
02194                     else {
02195                         tob->flag |= TD_NOTCONNECTED;
02196                         tob->dist = MAXFLOAT;
02197                     }
02198                 }
02199 
02200                 /* CrazySpace */
02201                 if (defmats || (quats && BM_elem_index_get(eve) != -1)) {
02202                     float mat[3][3], qmat[3][3], imat[3][3];
02203 
02204                     /* use both or either quat and defmat correction */
02205                     if (quats && BM_elem_index_get(eve) != -1) {
02206                         quat_to_mat3(qmat, quats + 4*BM_elem_index_get(eve));
02207 
02208                         if (defmats)
02209                             mul_serie_m3(mat, mtx, qmat, defmats[a],
02210                                 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
02211                         else
02212                             mul_m3_m3m3(mat, mtx, qmat);
02213                     }
02214                     else
02215                         mul_m3_m3m3(mat, mtx, defmats[a]);
02216 
02217                     invert_m3_m3(imat, mat);
02218 
02219                     copy_m3_m3(tob->smtx, imat);
02220                     copy_m3_m3(tob->mtx, mat);
02221                 }
02222                 else {
02223                     copy_m3_m3(tob->smtx, smtx);
02224                     copy_m3_m3(tob->mtx, mtx);
02225                 }
02226 
02227                 /* Mirror? */
02228                 if ( (mirror>0 && tob->iloc[0]>0.0f) || (mirror<0 && tob->iloc[0]<0.0f)) {
02229                     BMVert *vmir= EDBM_verts_mirror_get(em, eve); //t->obedit, em, eve, tob->iloc, a);
02230                     if (vmir && vmir != eve) {
02231                         tob->extra = vmir;
02232                     }
02233                 }
02234                 tob++;
02235             }
02236         }
02237     }
02238     
02239     if (mirror != 0)
02240     {
02241         tob = t->data;
02242         for ( a = 0; a < t->total; a++, tob++ )
02243         {
02244             if (ABS(tob->loc[0]) <= 0.00001f)
02245             {
02246                 tob->flag |= TD_MIRROR_EDGE;
02247             }
02248         }
02249     }
02250 
02251 cleanup:
02252     /* crazy space free */
02253     if (quats)
02254         MEM_freeN(quats);
02255     if (defmats)
02256         MEM_freeN(defmats);
02257     if (dists)
02258         MEM_freeN(dists);
02259     
02260     MEM_freeN(selstate);
02261 
02262     if (t->flag & T_MIRROR) {
02263         EDBM_verts_mirror_cache_end(em);
02264         mirror = 1;
02265     }
02266 }
02267 
02268 /* *** NODE EDITOR *** */
02269 void flushTransNodes(TransInfo *t)
02270 {
02271     int a;
02272     TransData2D *td;
02273 
02274     /* flush to 2d vector from internally used 3d vector */
02275     for (a=0, td= t->data2d; a<t->total; a++, td++) {
02276         td->loc2d[0]= td->loc[0];
02277         td->loc2d[1]= td->loc[1];
02278     }
02279     
02280     /* handle intersection with noodles */
02281     if (t->total==1) {
02282         ED_node_link_intersect_test(t->sa, 1);
02283     }
02284     
02285 }
02286 
02287 /* *** SEQUENCE EDITOR *** */
02288 
02289 /* commented _only_ because the meta may have animation data which
02290  * needs moving too [#28158] */
02291 
02292 #define SEQ_TX_NESTED_METAS
02293 
02294 void flushTransSeq(TransInfo *t)
02295 {
02296     ListBase *seqbasep= seq_give_editing(t->scene, FALSE)->seqbasep; /* Editing null check already done */
02297     int a, new_frame, old_start;
02298     TransData *td= NULL;
02299     TransData2D *td2d= NULL;
02300     TransDataSeq *tdsq= NULL;
02301     Sequence *seq;
02302 
02303 
02304 
02305     /* prevent updating the same seq twice
02306      * if the transdata order is changed this will mess up
02307      * but so will TransDataSeq */
02308     Sequence *seq_prev= NULL;
02309 
02310     /* flush to 2d vector from internally used 3d vector */
02311     for (a=0, td= t->data, td2d= t->data2d; a<t->total; a++, td++, td2d++) {
02312         tdsq= (TransDataSeq *)td->extra;
02313         seq= tdsq->seq;
02314         old_start = seq->start;
02315         new_frame= (int)floor(td2d->loc[0] + 0.5f);
02316 
02317         switch (tdsq->sel_flag) {
02318         case SELECT:
02319 #ifdef SEQ_TX_NESTED_METAS
02320             if ((seq->depth != 0 || seq_tx_test(seq))) /* for meta's, their children move */
02321                 seq->start= new_frame - tdsq->start_offset;
02322 #else
02323             if (seq->type != SEQ_META && (seq->depth != 0 || seq_tx_test(seq))) /* for meta's, their children move */
02324                 seq->start= new_frame - tdsq->start_offset;
02325 #endif
02326             if (seq->depth==0) {
02327                 seq->machine= (int)floor(td2d->loc[1] + 0.5f);
02328                 CLAMP(seq->machine, 1, MAXSEQ);
02329             }
02330             break;
02331         case SEQ_LEFTSEL: /* no vertical transform  */
02332             seq_tx_set_final_left(seq, new_frame);
02333             seq_tx_handle_xlimits(seq, tdsq->flag&SEQ_LEFTSEL, tdsq->flag&SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
02334             seq_single_fix(seq); /* todo - move this into aftertrans update? - old seq tx needed it anyway */
02335             break;
02336         case SEQ_RIGHTSEL: /* no vertical transform  */
02337             seq_tx_set_final_right(seq, new_frame);
02338             seq_tx_handle_xlimits(seq, tdsq->flag&SEQ_LEFTSEL, tdsq->flag&SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
02339             seq_single_fix(seq); /* todo - move this into aftertrans update? - old seq tx needed it anyway */
02340             break;
02341         }
02342 
02343         if (seq != seq_prev) {
02344             if (seq->depth==0) {
02345                 /* Calculate this strip and all nested strips
02346                  * children are ALWAYS transformed first
02347                  * so we don't need to do this in another loop. */
02348                 calc_sequence(t->scene, seq);
02349             }
02350             else {
02351                 calc_sequence_disp(t->scene, seq);
02352             }
02353 
02354             if (tdsq->sel_flag == SELECT)
02355                 seq_offset_animdata(t->scene, seq, seq->start - old_start);
02356         }
02357         seq_prev= seq;
02358     }
02359 
02360 
02361     if (ELEM(t->mode, TFM_SEQ_SLIDE, TFM_TIME_TRANSLATE)) { /* originally TFM_TIME_EXTEND, transform changes */
02362         /* Special annoying case here, need to calc metas with TFM_TIME_EXTEND only */
02363 
02364         /* calc all meta's then effects [#27953] */
02365         for (seq = seqbasep->first; seq; seq = seq->next) {
02366             if (seq->type == SEQ_META && seq->flag & SELECT) {
02367                 calc_sequence(t->scene, seq);
02368             }
02369         }
02370         for (seq = seqbasep->first; seq; seq = seq->next) {
02371             if (seq->seq1 || seq->seq2 || seq->seq3) {
02372                 calc_sequence(t->scene, seq);
02373             }
02374         }
02375     }
02376 
02377     /* need to do the overlap check in a new loop otherwise adjacent strips
02378      * will not be updated and we'll get false positives */
02379     seq_prev= NULL;
02380     for (a=0, td= t->data, td2d= t->data2d; a<t->total; a++, td++, td2d++) {
02381 
02382         tdsq= (TransDataSeq *)td->extra;
02383         seq= tdsq->seq;
02384 
02385         if (seq != seq_prev) {
02386             if (seq->depth==0) {
02387                 /* test overlap, displayes red outline */
02388                 seq->flag &= ~SEQ_OVERLAP;
02389                 if ( seq_test_overlap(seqbasep, seq) ) {
02390                     seq->flag |= SEQ_OVERLAP;
02391                 }
02392             }
02393         }
02394         seq_prev= seq;
02395     }
02396 }
02397 
02398 /* ********************* UV ****************** */
02399 
02400 static void UVsToTransData(SpaceImage *sima, TransData *td, TransData2D *td2d, float *uv, int selected)
02401 {
02402     float aspx, aspy;
02403 
02404     ED_space_image_uv_aspect(sima, &aspx, &aspy);
02405 
02406     /* uv coords are scaled by aspects. this is needed for rotations and
02407      * proportional editing to be consistent with the stretched uv coords
02408      * that are displayed. this also means that for display and numinput,
02409      * and when the the uv coords are flushed, these are converted each time */
02410     td2d->loc[0] = uv[0]*aspx;
02411     td2d->loc[1] = uv[1]*aspy;
02412     td2d->loc[2] = 0.0f;
02413     td2d->loc2d = uv;
02414 
02415     td->flag = 0;
02416     td->loc = td2d->loc;
02417     copy_v3_v3(td->center, td->loc);
02418     copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, td->loc);
02419 
02420     memset(td->axismtx, 0, sizeof(td->axismtx));
02421     td->axismtx[2][2] = 1.0f;
02422 
02423     td->ext= NULL; td->val= NULL;
02424 
02425     if (selected) {
02426         td->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
02427         td->dist= 0.0;
02428     }
02429     else {
02430         td->dist= MAXFLOAT;
02431     }
02432     unit_m3(td->mtx);
02433     unit_m3(td->smtx);
02434 }
02435 
02436 static void createTransUVs(bContext *C, TransInfo *t)
02437 {
02438     SpaceImage *sima = CTX_wm_space_image(C);
02439     Image *ima = CTX_data_edit_image(C);
02440     Scene *scene = t->scene;
02441     TransData *td = NULL;
02442     TransData2D *td2d = NULL;
02443     MTexPoly *tf;
02444     MLoopUV *luv;
02445     BMEditMesh *em = BMEdit_FromObject(t->obedit);
02446     BMFace *efa;
02447     BMLoop *l;
02448     BMIter iter, liter;
02449     int count=0, countsel=0;
02450     int propmode = t->flag & T_PROP_EDIT;
02451 
02452     if (!ED_space_image_show_uvedit(sima, t->obedit)) return;
02453 
02454     /* count */
02455     BM_ITER_MESH (efa, &iter, em->bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
02456         tf= CustomData_bmesh_get(&em->bm->pdata, efa->head.data, CD_MTEXPOLY);
02457 
02458         if (!uvedit_face_visible_test(scene, ima, efa, tf)) {
02459             BM_elem_flag_disable(efa, BM_ELEM_TAG);
02460             continue;
02461         }
02462         
02463         BM_elem_flag_enable(efa, BM_ELEM_TAG);
02464         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, efa, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
02465             if (uvedit_uv_select_test(em, scene, l)) 
02466                 countsel++;
02467 
02468             if (propmode)
02469                 count++;
02470         }
02471     }
02472 
02473      /* note: in prop mode we need at least 1 selected */
02474     if (countsel==0) return;
02475 
02476     t->total= (propmode)? count: countsel;
02477     t->data= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData), "TransObData(UV Editing)");
02478     /* for each 2d uv coord a 3d vector is allocated, so that they can be
02479      * treated just as if they were 3d verts */
02480     t->data2d= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData2D), "TransObData2D(UV Editing)");
02481 
02482     if (sima->flag & SI_CLIP_UV)
02483         t->flag |= T_CLIP_UV;
02484 
02485     td= t->data;
02486     td2d= t->data2d;
02487 
02488     BM_ITER_MESH (efa, &iter, em->bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
02489         if (!BM_elem_flag_test(efa, BM_ELEM_TAG))
02490             continue;
02491 
02492         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, efa, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
02493             if (!propmode && !uvedit_uv_select_test(em, scene, l))
02494                 continue;
02495             
02496             luv = CustomData_bmesh_get(&em->bm->ldata, l->head.data, CD_MLOOPUV);
02497             UVsToTransData(sima, td++, td2d++, luv->uv, uvedit_uv_select_test(em, scene, l));
02498         }
02499     }
02500 
02501     if (sima->flag & SI_LIVE_UNWRAP)
02502         ED_uvedit_live_unwrap_begin(t->scene, t->obedit);
02503 }
02504 
02505 void flushTransUVs(TransInfo *t)
02506 {
02507     SpaceImage *sima = t->sa->spacedata.first;
02508     TransData2D *td;
02509     int a, width, height;
02510     float aspx, aspy, invx, invy;
02511 
02512     ED_space_image_uv_aspect(sima, &aspx, &aspy);
02513     ED_space_image_size(sima, &width, &height);
02514     invx= 1.0f/aspx;
02515     invy= 1.0f/aspy;
02516 
02517     /* flush to 2d vector from internally used 3d vector */
02518     for (a=0, td= t->data2d; a<t->total; a++, td++) {
02519         td->loc2d[0]= td->loc[0]*invx;
02520         td->loc2d[1]= td->loc[1]*invy;
02521 
02522         if ((sima->flag & SI_PIXELSNAP) && (t->state != TRANS_CANCEL)) {
02523             td->loc2d[0]= (float)floor(width*td->loc2d[0] + 0.5f)/width;
02524             td->loc2d[1]= (float)floor(height*td->loc2d[1] + 0.5f)/height;
02525         }
02526     }
02527 }
02528 
02529 int clipUVTransform(TransInfo *t, float *vec, int resize)
02530 {
02531     TransData *td;
02532     int a, clipx=1, clipy=1;
02533     float aspx, aspy, min[2], max[2];
02534 
02535     ED_space_image_uv_aspect(t->sa->spacedata.first, &aspx, &aspy);
02536     min[0]= min[1]= 0.0f;
02537     max[0]= aspx; max[1]= aspy;
02538 
02539     for (a=0, td= t->data; a<t->total; a++, td++) {
02540         DO_MINMAX2(td->loc, min, max);
02541     }
02542 
02543     if (resize) {
02544         if (min[0] < 0.0f && t->center[0] > 0.0f && t->center[0] < aspx*0.5f)
02545             vec[0] *= t->center[0]/(t->center[0] - min[0]);
02546         else if (max[0] > aspx && t->center[0] < aspx)
02547             vec[0] *= (t->center[0] - aspx)/(t->center[0] - max[0]);
02548         else
02549             clipx= 0;
02550 
02551         if (min[1] < 0.0f && t->center[1] > 0.0f && t->center[1] < aspy*0.5f)
02552             vec[1] *= t->center[1]/(t->center[1] - min[1]);
02553         else if (max[1] > aspy && t->center[1] < aspy)
02554             vec[1] *= (t->center[1] - aspy)/(t->center[1] - max[1]);
02555         else
02556             clipy= 0;
02557     }
02558     else {
02559         if (min[0] < 0.0f)
02560             vec[0] -= min[0];
02561         else if (max[0] > aspx)
02562             vec[0] -= max[0]-aspx;
02563         else
02564             clipx= 0;
02565 
02566         if (min[1] < 0.0f)
02567             vec[1] -= min[1];
02568         else if (max[1] > aspy)
02569             vec[1] -= max[1]-aspy;
02570         else
02571             clipy= 0;
02572     }
02573 
02574     return (clipx || clipy);
02575 }
02576 
02577 /* ********************* ANIMATION EDITORS (GENERAL) ************************* */
02578 
02579 /* This function tests if a point is on the "mouse" side of the cursor/frame-marking */
02580 static short FrameOnMouseSide(char side, float frame, float cframe)
02581 {
02582     /* both sides, so it doesn't matter */
02583     if (side == 'B') return 1;
02584 
02585     /* only on the named side */
02586     if (side == 'R')
02587         return (frame >= cframe) ? 1 : 0;
02588     else
02589         return (frame <= cframe) ? 1 : 0;
02590 }
02591 
02592 /* ********************* NLA EDITOR ************************* */
02593 
02594 static void createTransNlaData(bContext *C, TransInfo *t)
02595 {
02596     Scene *scene= t->scene;
02597     SpaceNla *snla = NULL;
02598     TransData *td = NULL;
02599     TransDataNla *tdn = NULL;
02600     
02601     bAnimContext ac;
02602     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
02603     bAnimListElem *ale;
02604     int filter;
02605     
02606     int count=0;
02607     
02608     /* determine what type of data we are operating on */
02609     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
02610         return;
02611     snla = (SpaceNla *)ac.sl;
02612     
02613     /* filter data */
02614     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_LIST_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT);
02615     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
02616     
02617     /* which side of the current frame should be allowed */
02618     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_EXTEND) {
02619         /* only side on which mouse is gets transformed */
02620         float xmouse, ymouse;
02621         
02622         UI_view2d_region_to_view(&ac.ar->v2d, t->imval[0], t->imval[1], &xmouse, &ymouse);
02623         t->frame_side= (xmouse > CFRA) ? 'R' : 'L';
02624     }
02625     else {
02626         /* normal transform - both sides of current frame are considered */
02627         t->frame_side = 'B';
02628     }
02629     
02630     /* loop 1: count how many strips are selected (consider each strip as 2 points) */
02631     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
02632         NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)ale->data;
02633         NlaStrip *strip;
02634         
02635         /* make some meta-strips for chains of selected strips */
02636         BKE_nlastrips_make_metas(&nlt->strips, 1);
02637         
02638         /* only consider selected strips */
02639         for (strip= nlt->strips.first; strip; strip= strip->next) {
02640             // TODO: we can make strips have handles later on...
02641             /* transition strips can't get directly transformed */
02642             if (strip->type != NLASTRIP_TYPE_TRANSITION) {
02643                 if (strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_SELECT) {
02644                     if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, strip->start, (float)CFRA)) count++;
02645                     if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, strip->end, (float)CFRA)) count++;
02646                 }
02647             }
02648         }
02649     }
02650     
02651     /* stop if trying to build list if nothing selected */
02652     if (count == 0) {
02653         /* cleanup temp list */
02654         BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
02655         return;
02656     }
02657     
02658     /* allocate memory for data */
02659     t->total= count;
02660     
02661     t->data= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData), "TransData(NLA Editor)");
02662     td= t->data;
02663     t->customData= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransDataNla), "TransDataNla (NLA Editor)");
02664     tdn= t->customData;
02665     t->flag |= T_FREE_CUSTOMDATA;
02666     
02667     /* loop 2: build transdata array */
02668     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
02669         /* only if a real NLA-track */
02670         if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_NLATRACK) {
02671             AnimData *adt = ale->adt;
02672             NlaTrack *nlt= (NlaTrack *)ale->data;
02673             NlaStrip *strip;
02674             
02675             /* only consider selected strips */
02676             for (strip= nlt->strips.first; strip; strip= strip->next) {
02677                 // TODO: we can make strips have handles later on...
02678                 /* transition strips can't get directly transformed */
02679                 if (strip->type != NLASTRIP_TYPE_TRANSITION) {
02680                     if (strip->flag & NLASTRIP_FLAG_SELECT) {
02681                         /* our transform data is constructed as follows:
02682                          *  - only the handles on the right side of the current-frame get included
02683                          *  - td structs are transform-elements operated on by the transform system
02684                          *    and represent a single handle. The storage/pointer used (val or loc) depends on
02685                          *    whether we're scaling or transforming. Ultimately though, the handles
02686                          *    the td writes to will simply be a dummy in tdn
02687                          *  - for each strip being transformed, a single tdn struct is used, so in some
02688                          *    cases, there will need to be 1 of these tdn elements in the array skipped...
02689                          */
02690                         float center[3], yval;
02691                         
02692                         /* firstly, init tdn settings */
02693                         tdn->id= ale->id;
02694                         tdn->oldTrack= tdn->nlt= nlt;
02695                         tdn->strip= strip;
02696                         tdn->trackIndex= BLI_findindex(&adt->nla_tracks, nlt);
02697                         
02698                         yval= (float)(tdn->trackIndex * NLACHANNEL_STEP(snla));
02699                         
02700                         tdn->h1[0]= strip->start;
02701                         tdn->h1[1]= yval;
02702                         tdn->h2[0]= strip->end;
02703                         tdn->h2[1]= yval;
02704                         
02705                         center[0]= (float)CFRA;
02706                         center[1]= yval;
02707                         center[2]= 0.0f;
02708                         
02709                         /* set td's based on which handles are applicable */
02710                         if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, strip->start, (float)CFRA))
02711                         {
02712                             /* just set tdn to assume that it only has one handle for now */
02713                             tdn->handle= -1;
02714                             
02715                             /* now, link the transform data up to this data */
02716                             if (ELEM(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_EXTEND)) {
02717                                 td->loc= tdn->h1;
02718                                 copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, tdn->h1);
02719                                 
02720                                 /* store all the other gunk that is required by transform */
02721                                 copy_v3_v3(td->center, center);
02722                                 memset(td->axismtx, 0, sizeof(td->axismtx));
02723                                 td->axismtx[2][2] = 1.0f;
02724                                 
02725                                 td->ext= NULL; td->val= NULL;
02726                                 
02727                                 td->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
02728                                 td->dist= 0.0f;
02729                                 
02730                                 unit_m3(td->mtx);
02731                                 unit_m3(td->smtx);
02732                             }
02733                             else {
02734                                 /* time scaling only needs single value */
02735                                 td->val= &tdn->h1[0];
02736                                 td->ival= tdn->h1[0];
02737                             }
02738                             
02739                             td->extra= tdn;
02740                             td++;
02741                         }
02742                         if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, strip->end, (float)CFRA))
02743                         {
02744                             /* if tdn is already holding the start handle, then we're doing both, otherwise, only end */
02745                             tdn->handle= (tdn->handle) ? 2 : 1;
02746                             
02747                             /* now, link the transform data up to this data */
02748                             if (ELEM(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_EXTEND)) {
02749                                 td->loc= tdn->h2;
02750                                 copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, tdn->h2);
02751                                 
02752                                 /* store all the other gunk that is required by transform */
02753                                 copy_v3_v3(td->center, center);
02754                                 memset(td->axismtx, 0, sizeof(td->axismtx));
02755                                 td->axismtx[2][2] = 1.0f;
02756                                 
02757                                 td->ext= NULL; td->val= NULL;
02758                                 
02759                                 td->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
02760                                 td->dist= 0.0f;
02761                                 
02762                                 unit_m3(td->mtx);
02763                                 unit_m3(td->smtx);
02764                             }
02765                             else {
02766                                 /* time scaling only needs single value */
02767                                 td->val= &tdn->h2[0];
02768                                 td->ival= tdn->h2[0];
02769                             }
02770                             
02771                             td->extra= tdn;
02772                             td++;
02773                         }
02774                         
02775                         /* if both handles were used, skip the next tdn (i.e. leave it blank) since the counting code is dumb...
02776                          * otherwise, just advance to the next one...
02777                          */
02778                         if (tdn->handle == 2)
02779                             tdn += 2;
02780                         else
02781                             tdn++;
02782                     }
02783                 }
02784             }
02785         }
02786     }
02787     
02788     /* cleanup temp list */
02789     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
02790 }
02791 
02792 /* ********************* ACTION EDITOR ****************** */
02793 
02794 /* Called by special_aftertrans_update to make sure selected gp-frames replace
02795  * any other gp-frames which may reside on that frame (that are not selected).
02796  * It also makes sure gp-frames are still stored in chronological order after
02797  * transform.
02798  */
02799 static void posttrans_gpd_clean (bGPdata *gpd)
02800 {
02801     bGPDlayer *gpl;
02802     
02803     for (gpl= gpd->layers.first; gpl; gpl= gpl->next) {
02804         ListBase sel_buffer = {NULL, NULL};
02805         bGPDframe *gpf, *gpfn;
02806         bGPDframe *gfs, *gfsn;
02807         
02808         /* loop 1: loop through and isolate selected gp-frames to buffer
02809          * (these need to be sorted as they are isolated)
02810          */
02811         for (gpf= gpl->frames.first; gpf; gpf= gpfn) {
02812             short added= 0;
02813             gpfn= gpf->next;
02814             
02815             if (gpf->flag & GP_FRAME_SELECT) {
02816                 BLI_remlink(&gpl->frames, gpf);
02817                 
02818                 /* find place to add them in buffer
02819                  * - go backwards as most frames will still be in order,
02820                  *   so doing it this way will be faster
02821                  */
02822                 for (gfs= sel_buffer.last; gfs; gfs= gfs->prev) {
02823                     /* if current (gpf) occurs after this one in buffer, add! */
02824                     if (gfs->framenum < gpf->framenum) {
02825                         BLI_insertlinkafter(&sel_buffer, gfs, gpf);
02826                         added= 1;
02827                         break;
02828                     }
02829                 }
02830                 if (added == 0)
02831                     BLI_addhead(&sel_buffer, gpf);
02832             }
02833         }
02834         
02835         /* error checking: it is unlikely, but may be possible to have none selected */
02836         if (sel_buffer.first == NULL)
02837             continue;
02838         
02839         /* if all were selected (i.e. gpl->frames is empty), then just transfer sel-buf over */
02840         if (gpl->frames.first == NULL) {
02841             gpl->frames.first= sel_buffer.first;
02842             gpl->frames.last= sel_buffer.last;
02843             
02844             continue;
02845         }
02846         
02847         /* loop 2: remove duplicates of frames in buffers */
02848         for (gpf= gpl->frames.first; gpf && sel_buffer.first; gpf= gpfn) {
02849             gpfn= gpf->next;
02850             
02851             /* loop through sel_buffer, emptying stuff from front of buffer if ok */
02852             for (gfs= sel_buffer.first; gfs && gpf; gfs= gfsn) {
02853                 gfsn= gfs->next;
02854                 
02855                 /* if this buffer frame needs to go before current, add it! */
02856                 if (gfs->framenum < gpf->framenum) {
02857                     /* transfer buffer frame to frames list (before current) */
02858                     BLI_remlink(&sel_buffer, gfs);
02859                     BLI_insertlinkbefore(&gpl->frames, gpf, gfs);
02860                 }
02861                 /* if this buffer frame is on same frame, replace current with it and stop */
02862                 else if (gfs->framenum == gpf->framenum) {
02863                     /* transfer buffer frame to frames list (before current) */
02864                     BLI_remlink(&sel_buffer, gfs);
02865                     BLI_insertlinkbefore(&gpl->frames, gpf, gfs);
02866                     
02867                     /* get rid of current frame */
02868                     gpencil_layer_delframe(gpl, gpf);
02869                 }
02870             }
02871         }
02872         
02873         /* if anything is still in buffer, append to end */
02874         for (gfs= sel_buffer.first; gfs; gfs= gfsn) {
02875             gfsn= gfs->next;
02876             
02877             BLI_remlink(&sel_buffer, gfs);
02878             BLI_addtail(&gpl->frames, gfs);
02879         }
02880     }
02881 }
02882 
02883 /* Called during special_aftertrans_update to make sure selected keyframes replace
02884  * any other keyframes which may reside on that frame (that is not selected).
02885  */
02886 static void posttrans_fcurve_clean (FCurve *fcu, const short use_handle)
02887 {
02888     float *selcache;    /* cache for frame numbers of selected frames (fcu->totvert*sizeof(float)) */
02889     int len, index, i;  /* number of frames in cache, item index */
02890 
02891     /* allocate memory for the cache */
02892     // TODO: investigate using BezTriple columns instead?
02893     if (fcu->totvert == 0 || fcu->bezt==NULL)
02894         return;
02895     selcache= MEM_callocN(sizeof(float)*fcu->totvert, "FCurveSelFrameNums");
02896     len= 0;
02897     index= 0;
02898 
02899     /* We do 2 loops, 1 for marking keyframes for deletion, one for deleting
02900      * as there is no guarantee what order the keyframes are exactly, even though
02901      * they have been sorted by time.
02902      */
02903 
02904     /*  Loop 1: find selected keyframes   */
02905     for (i = 0; i < fcu->totvert; i++) {
02906         BezTriple *bezt= &fcu->bezt[i];
02907         
02908         if (BEZSELECTED(bezt)) {
02909             selcache[index]= bezt->vec[1][0];
02910             index++;
02911             len++;
02912         }
02913     }
02914 
02915     /* Loop 2: delete unselected keyframes on the same frames 
02916      * (if any keyframes were found, or the whole curve wasn't affected) 
02917      */
02918     if ((len) && (len != fcu->totvert)) {
02919         for (i= fcu->totvert-1; i >= 0; i--) {
02920             BezTriple *bezt= &fcu->bezt[i];
02921             
02922             if (BEZSELECTED(bezt) == 0) {
02923                 /* check beztriple should be removed according to cache */
02924                 for (index= 0; index < len; index++) {
02925                     if (IS_EQF(bezt->vec[1][0], selcache[index])) {
02926                         delete_fcurve_key(fcu, i, 0);
02927                         break;
02928                     }
02929                     else if (bezt->vec[1][0] < selcache[index])
02930                         break;
02931                 }
02932             }
02933         }
02934         
02935         testhandles_fcurve(fcu, use_handle);
02936     }
02937 
02938     /* free cache */
02939     MEM_freeN(selcache);
02940 }
02941 
02942 
02943 
02944 /* Called by special_aftertrans_update to make sure selected keyframes replace
02945  * any other keyframes which may reside on that frame (that is not selected).
02946  * remake_action_ipos should have already been called
02947  */
02948 static void posttrans_action_clean (bAnimContext *ac, bAction *act)
02949 {
02950     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
02951     bAnimListElem *ale;
02952     int filter;
02953 
02954     /* filter data */
02955     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT /*| ANIMFILTER_CURVESONLY*/);
02956     ANIM_animdata_filter(ac, &anim_data, filter, act, ANIMCONT_ACTION);
02957 
02958     /* loop through relevant data, removing keyframes as appropriate
02959      *      - all keyframes are converted in/out of global time
02960      */
02961     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
02962         AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(ac, ale);
02963         
02964         if (adt) {
02965             ANIM_nla_mapping_apply_fcurve(adt, ale->key_data, 0, 1);
02966             posttrans_fcurve_clean(ale->key_data, FALSE); /* only use handles in graph editor */
02967             ANIM_nla_mapping_apply_fcurve(adt, ale->key_data, 1, 1);
02968         }
02969         else
02970             posttrans_fcurve_clean(ale->key_data, FALSE); /* only use handles in graph editor */
02971     }
02972 
02973     /* free temp data */
02974     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
02975 }
02976 
02977 /* ----------------------------- */
02978 
02979 /* fully select selected beztriples, but only include if it's on the right side of cfra */
02980 static int count_fcurve_keys(FCurve *fcu, char side, float cfra)
02981 {
02982     BezTriple *bezt;
02983     int i, count = 0;
02984 
02985     if (ELEM(NULL, fcu, fcu->bezt))
02986         return count;
02987 
02988     /* only include points that occur on the right side of cfra */
02989     for (i=0, bezt=fcu->bezt; i < fcu->totvert; i++, bezt++) {
02990         if (bezt->f2 & SELECT) {
02991             /* no need to adjust the handle selection since they are assumed
02992              * selected (like graph editor with SIPO_NOHANDLES) */
02993             if (FrameOnMouseSide(side, bezt->vec[1][0], cfra)) {
02994                 count += 1;
02995             }
02996         }
02997     }
02998 
02999     return count;
03000 }
03001 
03002 /* fully select selected beztriples, but only include if it's on the right side of cfra */
03003 static int count_gplayer_frames(bGPDlayer *gpl, char side, float cfra)
03004 {
03005     bGPDframe *gpf;
03006     int count = 0;
03007     
03008     if (gpl == NULL)
03009         return count;
03010     
03011     /* only include points that occur on the right side of cfra */
03012     for (gpf= gpl->frames.first; gpf; gpf= gpf->next) {
03013         if (gpf->flag & GP_FRAME_SELECT) {
03014             if (FrameOnMouseSide(side, (float)gpf->framenum, cfra))
03015                 count++;
03016         }
03017     }
03018     
03019     return count;
03020 }
03021 
03022 /* This function assigns the information to transdata */
03023 static void TimeToTransData(TransData *td, float *time, AnimData *adt)
03024 {
03025     /* memory is calloc'ed, so that should zero everything nicely for us */
03026     td->val = time;
03027     td->ival = *(time);
03028 
03029     /* store the AnimData where this keyframe exists as a keyframe of the
03030      * active action as td->extra.
03031      */
03032     td->extra= adt;
03033 }
03034 
03035 /* This function advances the address to which td points to, so it must return
03036  * the new address so that the next time new transform data is added, it doesn't
03037  * overwrite the existing ones...  i.e.   td = IcuToTransData(td, icu, ob, side, cfra);
03038  *
03039  * The 'side' argument is needed for the extend mode. 'B' = both sides, 'R'/'L' mean only data
03040  * on the named side are used.
03041  */
03042 static TransData *ActionFCurveToTransData(TransData *td, TransData2D **td2dv, FCurve *fcu, AnimData *adt, char side, float cfra)
03043 {
03044     BezTriple *bezt;
03045     TransData2D *td2d = *td2dv;
03046     int i;
03047 
03048     if (ELEM(NULL, fcu, fcu->bezt))
03049         return td;
03050 
03051     for (i=0, bezt=fcu->bezt; i < fcu->totvert; i++, bezt++) {
03052         /* only add selected keyframes (for now, proportional edit is not enabled) */
03053         if (bezt->f2 & SELECT) { /* note this MUST match count_fcurve_keys(), so can't use BEZSELECTED() macro */
03054             /* only add if on the right 'side' of the current frame */
03055             if (FrameOnMouseSide(side, bezt->vec[1][0], cfra)) {
03056                 TimeToTransData(td, bezt->vec[1], adt);
03057                 
03058                 /*set flags to move handles as necessary*/
03059                 td->flag |= TD_MOVEHANDLE1|TD_MOVEHANDLE2;
03060                 td2d->h1 = bezt->vec[0];
03061                 td2d->h2 = bezt->vec[2];
03062                 
03063                 copy_v2_v2(td2d->ih1, td2d->h1);
03064                 copy_v2_v2(td2d->ih2, td2d->h2);
03065                 
03066                 td++;
03067                 td2d++;
03068             }
03069         }
03070     }
03071     
03072     *td2dv = td2d;
03073     
03074     return td;
03075 }
03076 
03077 /* helper struct for gp-frame transforms (only used here) */
03078 typedef struct tGPFtransdata {
03079     float val;          /* where transdata writes transform */
03080     int *sdata;         /* pointer to gpf->framenum */
03081 } tGPFtransdata;
03082 
03083 /* This function helps flush transdata written to tempdata into the gp-frames  */
03084 void flushTransGPactionData (TransInfo *t)
03085 {
03086     tGPFtransdata *tfd;
03087     int i;
03088 
03089     /* find the first one to start from */
03090     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_SLIDE)
03091         tfd= (tGPFtransdata *)( (float *)(t->customData) + 2 );
03092     else
03093         tfd= (tGPFtransdata *)(t->customData);
03094 
03095     /* flush data! */
03096     for (i = 0; i < t->total; i++, tfd++) {
03097         *(tfd->sdata)= (int)floor(tfd->val + 0.5f);
03098     }
03099 }
03100 
03101 /* This function advances the address to which td points to, so it must return
03102  * the new address so that the next time new transform data is added, it doesn't
03103  * overwrite the existing ones...  i.e.   td = GPLayerToTransData(td, ipo, ob, side, cfra);
03104  *
03105  * The 'side' argument is needed for the extend mode. 'B' = both sides, 'R'/'L' mean only data
03106  * on the named side are used.
03107  */
03108 static int GPLayerToTransData (TransData *td, tGPFtransdata *tfd, bGPDlayer *gpl, char side, float cfra)
03109 {
03110     bGPDframe *gpf;
03111     int count= 0;
03112     
03113     /* check for select frames on right side of current frame */
03114     for (gpf= gpl->frames.first; gpf; gpf= gpf->next) {
03115         if (gpf->flag & GP_FRAME_SELECT) {
03116             if (FrameOnMouseSide(side, (float)gpf->framenum, cfra)) {
03117                 /* memory is calloc'ed, so that should zero everything nicely for us */
03118                 td->val= &tfd->val;
03119                 td->ival= (float)gpf->framenum;
03120                 
03121                 tfd->val= (float)gpf->framenum;
03122                 tfd->sdata= &gpf->framenum;
03123                 
03124                 /* advance td now */
03125                 td++;
03126                 tfd++;
03127                 count++;
03128             }
03129         }
03130     }
03131     
03132     return count;
03133 }
03134 
03135 static void createTransActionData(bContext *C, TransInfo *t)
03136 {
03137     Scene *scene= t->scene;
03138     TransData *td = NULL;
03139     TransData2D *td2d = NULL;
03140     tGPFtransdata *tfd = NULL;
03141     
03142     bAnimContext ac;
03143     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
03144     bAnimListElem *ale;
03145     int filter;
03146     
03147     int count=0;
03148     float cfra;
03149     
03150     /* determine what type of data we are operating on */
03151     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
03152         return;
03153     
03154     /* filter data */
03155     if (ac.datatype == ANIMCONT_GPENCIL)
03156         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT);
03157     else
03158         filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT /*| ANIMFILTER_CURVESONLY*/);
03159     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
03160     
03161     /* which side of the current frame should be allowed */
03162     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_EXTEND) {
03163         /* only side on which mouse is gets transformed */
03164         float xmouse, ymouse;
03165         
03166         UI_view2d_region_to_view(&ac.ar->v2d, t->imval[0], t->imval[1], &xmouse, &ymouse);
03167         t->frame_side = (xmouse > CFRA) ? 'R' : 'L'; // XXX use t->frame_side
03168     }
03169     else {
03170         /* normal transform - both sides of current frame are considered */
03171         t->frame_side = 'B';
03172     }
03173     
03174     /* loop 1: fully select ipo-keys and count how many BezTriples are selected */
03175     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
03176         AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(&ac, ale);
03177         
03178         /* convert current-frame to action-time (slightly less accurate, especially under
03179          * higher scaling ratios, but is faster than converting all points)
03180          */
03181         if (adt)
03182             cfra = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, (float)CFRA, NLATIME_CONVERT_UNMAP);
03183         else
03184             cfra = (float)CFRA;
03185         
03186         if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_FCURVE)
03187             count += count_fcurve_keys(ale->key_data, t->frame_side, cfra);
03188         else
03189             count += count_gplayer_frames(ale->data, t->frame_side, cfra);
03190     }
03191     
03192     /* stop if trying to build list if nothing selected */
03193     if (count == 0) {
03194         /* cleanup temp list */
03195         BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
03196         return;
03197     }
03198     
03199     /* allocate memory for data */
03200     t->total= count;
03201     
03202     t->data= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData), "TransData(Action Editor)");
03203     t->data2d= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData2D), "transdata2d");
03204     td= t->data;
03205     td2d = t->data2d;
03206     
03207     if (ac.datatype == ANIMCONT_GPENCIL) {
03208         if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_SLIDE) {
03209             t->customData= MEM_callocN((sizeof(float)*2)+(sizeof(tGPFtransdata)*count), "TimeSlide + tGPFtransdata");
03210             tfd= (tGPFtransdata *)( (float *)(t->customData) + 2 );
03211         }
03212         else {
03213             t->customData= MEM_callocN(sizeof(tGPFtransdata)*count, "tGPFtransdata");
03214             tfd= (tGPFtransdata *)(t->customData);
03215         }
03216     }
03217     else if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_SLIDE)
03218         t->customData= MEM_callocN(sizeof(float)*2, "TimeSlide Min/Max");
03219     
03220     /* loop 2: build transdata array */
03221     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
03222         if (ale->type == ANIMTYPE_GPLAYER) {
03223             bGPDlayer *gpl= (bGPDlayer *)ale->data;
03224             int i;
03225             
03226             i = GPLayerToTransData(td, tfd, gpl, t->frame_side, cfra);
03227             td += i;
03228             tfd += i;
03229         }
03230         else {
03231             AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(&ac, ale);
03232             FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->key_data;
03233             
03234             /* convert current-frame to action-time (slightly less accurate, especially under
03235              * higher scaling ratios, but is faster than converting all points)
03236              */
03237             if (adt)
03238                 cfra = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, (float)CFRA, NLATIME_CONVERT_UNMAP);
03239             else
03240                 cfra = (float)CFRA;
03241             
03242             td= ActionFCurveToTransData(td, &td2d, fcu, adt, t->frame_side, cfra);
03243         }
03244     }
03245     
03246     /* check if we're supposed to be setting minx/maxx for TimeSlide */
03247     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_SLIDE) {
03248         float min=999999999.0f, max=-999999999.0f;
03249         int i;
03250         
03251         td= t->data;
03252         for (i=0; i < count; i++, td++) {
03253             if (min > *(td->val)) min= *(td->val);
03254             if (max < *(td->val)) max= *(td->val);
03255         }
03256         
03257         if (min == max) {
03258             /* just use the current frame ranges */
03259             min = (float)PSFRA;
03260             max = (float)PEFRA;
03261         }
03262         
03263         /* minx/maxx values used by TimeSlide are stored as a
03264          * calloced 2-float array in t->customData. This gets freed
03265          * in postTrans (T_FREE_CUSTOMDATA).
03266          */
03267         *((float *)(t->customData)) = min;
03268         *((float *)(t->customData) + 1) = max;
03269     }
03270 
03271     /* cleanup temp list */
03272     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
03273 }
03274 
03275 /* ********************* GRAPH EDITOR ************************* */
03276 
03277 /* Helper function for createTransGraphEditData, which is responsible for associating
03278  * source data with transform data
03279  */
03280 static void bezt_to_transdata (TransData *td, TransData2D *td2d, AnimData *adt, BezTriple *bezt, 
03281                 int bi, short selected, short ishandle, short intvals, 
03282                 float mtx[3][3], float smtx[3][3])
03283 {
03284     float *loc = bezt->vec[bi];
03285     float *cent = bezt->vec[1];
03286 
03287     /* New location from td gets dumped onto the old-location of td2d, which then
03288      * gets copied to the actual data at td2d->loc2d (bezt->vec[n])
03289      *
03290      * Due to NLA mapping, we apply NLA mapping to some of the verts here,
03291      * and then that mapping will be undone after transform is done.
03292      */
03293     
03294     if (adt) {
03295         td2d->loc[0] = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, loc[0], NLATIME_CONVERT_MAP);
03296         td2d->loc[1] = loc[1];
03297         td2d->loc[2] = 0.0f;
03298         td2d->loc2d = loc;
03299         
03300         td->loc = td2d->loc;
03301         td->center[0] = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, cent[0], NLATIME_CONVERT_MAP);
03302         td->center[1] = cent[1];
03303         td->center[2] = 0.0f;
03304         
03305         copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, td->loc);
03306     }
03307     else {
03308         td2d->loc[0] = loc[0];
03309         td2d->loc[1] = loc[1];
03310         td2d->loc[2] = 0.0f;
03311         td2d->loc2d = loc;
03312         
03313         td->loc = td2d->loc;
03314         copy_v3_v3(td->center, cent);
03315         copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, td->loc);
03316     }
03317 
03318     if (td->flag & TD_MOVEHANDLE1) {
03319         td2d->h1 = bezt->vec[0];
03320         copy_v2_v2(td2d->ih1, td2d->h1);
03321     } 
03322     else    
03323         td2d->h1 = NULL;
03324 
03325     if (td->flag & TD_MOVEHANDLE2) {
03326         td2d->h2 = bezt->vec[2];
03327         copy_v2_v2(td2d->ih2, td2d->h2);
03328     } 
03329     else 
03330         td2d->h2 = NULL;
03331 
03332     memset(td->axismtx, 0, sizeof(td->axismtx));
03333     td->axismtx[2][2] = 1.0f;
03334     
03335     td->ext= NULL; td->val= NULL;
03336     
03337     /* store AnimData info in td->extra, for applying mapping when flushing */
03338     td->extra= adt;
03339     
03340     if (selected) {
03341         td->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
03342         td->dist= 0.0f;
03343     }
03344     else
03345         td->dist= MAXFLOAT;
03346     
03347     if (ishandle)
03348         td->flag |= TD_NOTIMESNAP;
03349     if (intvals)
03350         td->flag |= TD_INTVALUES;
03351 
03352     /* copy space-conversion matrices for dealing with non-uniform scales */
03353     copy_m3_m3(td->mtx, mtx);
03354     copy_m3_m3(td->smtx, smtx);
03355 }
03356 
03357 static void createTransGraphEditData(bContext *C, TransInfo *t)
03358 {
03359     SpaceIpo *sipo = (SpaceIpo *)t->sa->spacedata.first;
03360     Scene *scene= t->scene;
03361     ARegion *ar= t->ar;
03362     View2D *v2d= &ar->v2d;
03363     
03364     TransData *td = NULL;
03365     TransData2D *td2d = NULL;
03366     
03367     bAnimContext ac;
03368     ListBase anim_data = {NULL, NULL};
03369     bAnimListElem *ale;
03370     int filter;
03371     
03372     BezTriple *bezt;
03373     int count=0, i;
03374     float cfra;
03375     float mtx[3][3], smtx[3][3];
03376     const short use_handle = !(sipo->flag & SIPO_NOHANDLES);
03377     
03378     /* determine what type of data we are operating on */
03379     if (ANIM_animdata_get_context(C, &ac) == 0)
03380         return;
03381     
03382     /* filter data */
03383     filter= (ANIMFILTER_DATA_VISIBLE | ANIMFILTER_FOREDIT | ANIMFILTER_CURVE_VISIBLE);
03384     ANIM_animdata_filter(&ac, &anim_data, filter, ac.data, ac.datatype);
03385     
03386     /* which side of the current frame should be allowed */
03387         // XXX we still want this mode, but how to get this using standard transform too?
03388     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_EXTEND) {
03389         /* only side on which mouse is gets transformed */
03390         float xmouse, ymouse;
03391         
03392         UI_view2d_region_to_view(v2d, t->imval[0], t->imval[1], &xmouse, &ymouse);
03393         t->frame_side = (xmouse > CFRA) ? 'R' : 'L'; // XXX use t->frame_side
03394     }
03395     else {
03396         /* normal transform - both sides of current frame are considered */
03397         t->frame_side = 'B';
03398     }
03399     
03400     /* loop 1: count how many BezTriples (specifically their verts) are selected (or should be edited) */
03401     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
03402         AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(&ac, ale);
03403         FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->key_data;
03404         
03405         /* convert current-frame to action-time (slightly less accurate, especially under
03406          * higher scaling ratios, but is faster than converting all points)
03407          */
03408         if (adt)
03409             cfra = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, (float)CFRA, NLATIME_CONVERT_UNMAP);
03410         else
03411             cfra = (float)CFRA;
03412         
03413         /* F-Curve may not have any keyframes */
03414         if (fcu->bezt == NULL)
03415             continue;
03416         
03417         /* only include BezTriples whose 'keyframe' occurs on the same side of the current frame as mouse */
03418         for (i=0, bezt=fcu->bezt; i < fcu->totvert; i++, bezt++) {
03419             if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, bezt->vec[1][0], cfra)) {
03420                 const char sel2= bezt->f2 & SELECT;
03421                 const char sel1= use_handle ? bezt->f1 & SELECT : sel2;
03422                 const char sel3= use_handle ? bezt->f3 & SELECT : sel2;
03423 
03424                 if (ELEM3(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_TRANSLATE, TFM_TIME_SLIDE)) {
03425                     /* for 'normal' pivots - just include anything that is selected.
03426                      * this works a bit differently in translation modes */
03427                     if (sel2) count++;
03428                     else {
03429                         if (sel1) count++;
03430                         if (sel3) count++;
03431                     }
03432                 } 
03433                 else if (sipo->around == V3D_LOCAL) {
03434                     /* for local-pivot we only need to count the number of selected handles only, so that centerpoints don't
03435                      * don't get moved wrong
03436                      */
03437                     if (bezt->ipo == BEZT_IPO_BEZ) {
03438                         if (sel1) count++;
03439                         if (sel3) count++;
03440                     }
03441                     /* else if (sel2) count++; // TODO: could this cause problems? */
03442                     /* - yes this causes problems, because no td is created for the center point */
03443                 }
03444                 else {
03445                     /* for 'normal' pivots - just include anything that is selected */
03446                     if (sel1) count++;
03447                     if (sel2) count++;
03448                     if (sel3) count++;
03449                 }
03450             }
03451         }
03452     }
03453     
03454     /* stop if trying to build list if nothing selected */
03455     if (count == 0) {
03456         /* cleanup temp list */
03457         BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
03458         return;
03459     }
03460     
03461     /* allocate memory for data */
03462     t->total= count;
03463     
03464     t->data= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData), "TransData (Graph Editor)");
03465         /* for each 2d vert a 3d vector is allocated, so that they can be treated just as if they were 3d verts */
03466     t->data2d= MEM_callocN(t->total*sizeof(TransData2D), "TransData2D (Graph Editor)");
03467     
03468     td= t->data;
03469     td2d= t->data2d;
03470     
03471     /* precompute space-conversion matrices for dealing with non-uniform scaling of Graph Editor */
03472     unit_m3(mtx);
03473     unit_m3(smtx);
03474     
03475     if (ELEM(t->mode, TFM_ROTATION, TFM_RESIZE)) {
03476         float xscale, yscale;
03477         
03478         /* apply scale factors to x and y axes of space-conversion matrices */
03479         UI_view2d_getscale(v2d, &xscale, &yscale);
03480         
03481         /* mtx is data to global (i.e. view) conversion */
03482         mul_v3_fl(mtx[0], xscale);
03483         mul_v3_fl(mtx[1], yscale);
03484         
03485         /* smtx is global (i.e. view) to data conversion */
03486         if (IS_EQF(xscale, 0.0f) == 0) mul_v3_fl(smtx[0], 1.0f/xscale);
03487         if (IS_EQF(yscale, 0.0f) == 0) mul_v3_fl(smtx[1], 1.0f/yscale);
03488     }
03489     
03490     /* loop 2: build transdata arrays */
03491     for (ale= anim_data.first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
03492         AnimData *adt= ANIM_nla_mapping_get(&ac, ale);
03493         FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->key_data;
03494         short intvals= (fcu->flag & FCURVE_INT_VALUES);
03495         
03496         /* convert current-frame to action-time (slightly less accurate, especially under
03497          * higher scaling ratios, but is faster than converting all points)
03498          */
03499         if (adt)
03500             cfra = BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, (float)CFRA, NLATIME_CONVERT_UNMAP);
03501         else
03502             cfra = (float)CFRA;
03503             
03504         /* F-Curve may not have any keyframes */
03505         if (fcu->bezt == NULL)
03506             continue;
03507         
03508         ANIM_unit_mapping_apply_fcurve(ac.scene, ale->id, ale->key_data, ANIM_UNITCONV_ONLYSEL|ANIM_UNITCONV_SELVERTS);
03509         
03510         /* only include BezTriples whose 'keyframe' occurs on the same side of the current frame as mouse (if applicable) */
03511         for (i=0, bezt= fcu->bezt; i < fcu->totvert; i++, bezt++) {
03512             if (FrameOnMouseSide(t->frame_side, bezt->vec[1][0], cfra)) {
03513                 const char sel2= bezt->f2 & SELECT;
03514                 const char sel1= use_handle ? bezt->f1 & SELECT : sel2;
03515                 const char sel3= use_handle ? bezt->f3 & SELECT : sel2;
03516 
03517                 TransDataCurveHandleFlags *hdata = NULL;
03518                 /* short h1=1, h2=1; */ /* UNUSED */
03519                 
03520                 /* only include handles if selected, irrespective of the interpolation modes.
03521                  * also, only treat handles specially if the center point isn't selected. 
03522                  */
03523                 if (!ELEM3(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_TRANSLATE, TFM_TIME_SLIDE) || !(sel2)) {
03524                     if (sel1) {
03525                         hdata = initTransDataCurveHandles(td, bezt);
03526                         bezt_to_transdata(td++, td2d++, adt, bezt, 0, 1, 1, intvals, mtx, smtx);
03527                     } 
03528                     else {
03529                         /* h1= 0; */ /* UNUSED */
03530                     }
03531                     
03532                     if (sel3) {
03533                         if (hdata==NULL)
03534                             hdata = initTransDataCurveHandles(td, bezt);
03535                         bezt_to_transdata(td++, td2d++, adt, bezt, 2, 1, 1, intvals, mtx, smtx);
03536                     } 
03537                     else {
03538                         /* h2= 0; */ /* UNUSED */
03539                     }
03540                 }
03541                 
03542                 /* only include main vert if selected */
03543                 if (sel2 && (sipo->around != V3D_LOCAL || ELEM3(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_TRANSLATE, TFM_TIME_SLIDE))) {
03544 
03545                     /* move handles relative to center */
03546                     if (ELEM3(t->mode, TFM_TRANSLATION, TFM_TIME_TRANSLATE, TFM_TIME_SLIDE)) {
03547                         if (sel1) td->flag |= TD_MOVEHANDLE1;
03548                         if (sel3) td->flag |= TD_MOVEHANDLE2;
03549                     }
03550                     
03551                     /* if handles were not selected, store their selection status */
03552                     if (!(sel1) && !(sel3)) {
03553                         if (hdata == NULL)
03554                             hdata = initTransDataCurveHandles(td, bezt);
03555                     }
03556                 
03557                     bezt_to_transdata(td++, td2d++, adt, bezt, 1, 1, 0, intvals, mtx, smtx);
03558                     
03559                 }
03560                 /* special hack (must be done after initTransDataCurveHandles(), as that stores handle settings to restore...):
03561                  *  - Check if we've got entire BezTriple selected and we're scaling/rotating that point,
03562                  *    then check if we're using auto-handles.
03563                  *  - If so, change them auto-handles to aligned handles so that handles get affected too
03564                  */
03565                 if ( ELEM(bezt->h1, HD_AUTO, HD_AUTO_ANIM) &&
03566                      ELEM(bezt->h2, HD_AUTO, HD_AUTO_ANIM) &&
03567                      ELEM(t->mode, TFM_ROTATION, TFM_RESIZE))
03568                 {
03569                     if (hdata && (sel1) && (sel3)) {
03570                         bezt->h1= HD_ALIGN;
03571                         bezt->h2= HD_ALIGN;
03572                     }
03573                 }
03574             }
03575         }
03576         
03577         /* Sets handles based on the selection */
03578         testhandles_fcurve(fcu, use_handle);
03579     }
03580     
03581     /* cleanup temp list */
03582     BLI_freelistN(&anim_data);
03583 }
03584 
03585 
03586 /* ------------------------ */
03587 
03588 /* struct for use in re-sorting BezTriples during Graph Editor transform */
03589 typedef struct BeztMap {
03590     BezTriple *bezt;
03591     unsigned int oldIndex;      /* index of bezt in fcu->bezt array before sorting */
03592     unsigned int newIndex;      /* index of bezt in fcu->bezt array after sorting */
03593     short swapHs;               /* swap order of handles (-1=clear; 0=not checked, 1=swap) */
03594     char pipo, cipo;            /* interpolation of current and next segments */
03595 } BeztMap;
03596 
03597 
03598 /* This function converts an FCurve's BezTriple array to a BeztMap array
03599  * NOTE: this allocates memory that will need to get freed later
03600  */
03601 static BeztMap *bezt_to_beztmaps (BezTriple *bezts, int totvert, const short UNUSED(use_handle))
03602 {
03603     BezTriple *bezt= bezts;
03604     BezTriple *prevbezt= NULL;
03605     BeztMap *bezm, *bezms;
03606     int i;
03607     
03608     /* allocate memory for this array */
03609     if (totvert==0 || bezts==NULL)
03610         return NULL;
03611     bezm= bezms= MEM_callocN(sizeof(BeztMap)*totvert, "BeztMaps");
03612     
03613     /* assign beztriples to beztmaps */
03614     for (i=0; i < totvert; i++, bezm++, prevbezt=bezt, bezt++) {
03615         bezm->bezt= bezt;
03616         
03617         bezm->oldIndex= i;
03618         bezm->newIndex= i;
03619         
03620         bezm->pipo= (prevbezt) ? prevbezt->ipo : bezt->ipo;
03621         bezm->cipo= bezt->ipo;
03622     }
03623 
03624     return bezms;
03625 }
03626 
03627 /* This function copies the code of sort_time_ipocurve, but acts on BeztMap structs instead */
03628 static void sort_time_beztmaps (BeztMap *bezms, int totvert, const short UNUSED(use_handle))
03629 {
03630     BeztMap *bezm;
03631     int i, ok= 1;
03632     
03633     /* keep repeating the process until nothing is out of place anymore */
03634     while (ok) {
03635         ok= 0;
03636         
03637         bezm= bezms;
03638         i= totvert;
03639         while (i--) {
03640             /* is current bezm out of order (i.e. occurs later than next)? */
03641             if (i > 0) {
03642                 if (bezm->bezt->vec[1][0] > (bezm+1)->bezt->vec[1][0]) {
03643                     bezm->newIndex++;
03644                     (bezm+1)->newIndex--;
03645                     
03646                     SWAP(BeztMap, *bezm, *(bezm+1));
03647                     
03648                     ok= 1;
03649                 }
03650             }
03651             
03652             /* do we need to check if the handles need to be swapped?
03653              * optimization: this only needs to be performed in the first loop
03654              */
03655             if (bezm->swapHs == 0) {
03656                 if ( (bezm->bezt->vec[0][0] > bezm->bezt->vec[1][0]) &&
03657                      (bezm->bezt->vec[2][0] < bezm->bezt->vec[1][0]) )
03658                 {
03659                     /* handles need to be swapped */
03660                     bezm->swapHs = 1;
03661                 }
03662                 else {
03663                     /* handles need to be cleared */
03664                     bezm->swapHs = -1;
03665                 }
03666             }
03667             
03668             bezm++;
03669         }
03670     }
03671 }
03672 
03673 /* This function firstly adjusts the pointers that the transdata has to each BezTriple */
03674 static void beztmap_to_data (TransInfo *t, FCurve *fcu, BeztMap *bezms, int totvert, const short UNUSED(use_handle))
03675 {
03676     BezTriple *bezts = fcu->bezt;
03677     BeztMap *bezm;
03678     TransData2D *td2d;
03679     TransData *td;
03680     int i, j;
03681     char *adjusted;
03682     
03683     /* dynamically allocate an array of chars to mark whether an TransData's
03684      * pointers have been fixed already, so that we don't override ones that are
03685      * already done
03686      */
03687     adjusted= MEM_callocN(t->total, "beztmap_adjusted_map");
03688     
03689     /* for each beztmap item, find if it is used anywhere */
03690     bezm= bezms;
03691     for (i= 0; i < totvert; i++, bezm++) {
03692         /* loop through transdata, testing if we have a hit
03693          * for the handles (vec[0]/vec[2]), we must also check if they need to be swapped...
03694          */
03695         td2d= t->data2d;
03696         td= t->data;
03697         for (j= 0; j < t->total; j++, td2d++, td++) {
03698             /* skip item if already marked */
03699             if (adjusted[j] != 0) continue;
03700             
03701             /* update all transdata pointers, no need to check for selections etc,
03702              * since only points that are really needed were created as transdata
03703              */
03704             if (td2d->loc2d == bezm->bezt->vec[0]) {
03705                 if (bezm->swapHs == 1)
03706                     td2d->loc2d= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[2];
03707                 else
03708                     td2d->loc2d= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[0];
03709                 adjusted[j] = 1;
03710             }
03711             else if (td2d->loc2d == bezm->bezt->vec[2]) {
03712                 if (bezm->swapHs == 1)
03713                     td2d->loc2d= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[0];
03714                 else
03715                     td2d->loc2d= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[2];
03716                 adjusted[j] = 1;
03717             }
03718             else if (td2d->loc2d == bezm->bezt->vec[1]) {
03719                 td2d->loc2d= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[1];
03720                     
03721                 /* if only control point is selected, the handle pointers need to be updated as well */
03722                 if (td2d->h1)
03723                     td2d->h1= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[0];
03724                 if (td2d->h2)
03725                     td2d->h2= (bezts + bezm->newIndex)->vec[2];
03726                     
03727                 adjusted[j] = 1;
03728             }
03729 
03730             /* the handle type pointer has to be updated too */
03731             if (adjusted[j] && td->flag & TD_BEZTRIPLE && td->hdata) {
03732                 if (bezm->swapHs == 1) {
03733                     td->hdata->h1 = &(bezts + bezm->newIndex)->h2;
03734                     td->hdata->h2 = &(bezts + bezm->newIndex)->h1;
03735                 }
03736                 else {
03737                     td->hdata->h1 = &(bezts + bezm->newIndex)->h1;
03738                     td->hdata->h2 = &(bezts + bezm->newIndex)->h2;
03739                 }
03740             }
03741         }
03742         
03743     }
03744     
03745     /* free temp memory used for 'adjusted' array */
03746     MEM_freeN(adjusted);
03747 }
03748 
03749 /* This function is called by recalcData during the Transform loop to recalculate
03750  * the handles of curves and sort the keyframes so that the curves draw correctly.
03751  * It is only called if some keyframes have moved out of order.
03752  *
03753  * anim_data is the list of channels (F-Curves) retrieved already containing the
03754  * channels to work on. It should not be freed here as it may still need to be used.
03755  */
03756 void remake_graph_transdata (TransInfo *t, ListBase *anim_data)
03757 {
03758     SpaceIpo *sipo = (SpaceIpo *)t->sa->spacedata.first;
03759     bAnimListElem *ale;
03760     const short use_handle = !(sipo->flag & SIPO_NOHANDLES);
03761     
03762     /* sort and reassign verts */
03763     for (ale= anim_data->first; ale; ale= ale->next) {
03764         FCurve *fcu= (FCurve *)ale->key_data;
03765         
03766         if (fcu->bezt) {
03767             BeztMap *bezm;
03768             
03769             /* adjust transform-data pointers */
03770             /* note, none of these functions use 'use_handle', it could be removed */
03771             bezm= bezt_to_beztmaps(fcu->bezt, fcu->totvert, use_handle);
03772             sort_time_beztmaps(bezm, fcu->totvert, use_handle);
03773             beztmap_to_data(t, fcu, bezm, fcu->totvert, use_handle);
03774             
03775             /* free mapping stuff */
03776             MEM_freeN(bezm);
03777             
03778             /* re-sort actual beztriples (perhaps this could be done using the beztmaps to save time?) */
03779             sort_time_fcurve(fcu);
03780             
03781             /* make sure handles are all set correctly */
03782             testhandles_fcurve(fcu, use_handle);
03783         }
03784     }
03785 }
03786 
03787 /* this function is called on recalcData to apply the transforms applied
03788  * to the transdata on to the actual keyframe data
03789  */
03790 void flushTransGraphData(TransInfo *t)
03791 {
03792     SpaceIpo *sipo = (SpaceIpo *)t->sa->spacedata.first;
03793     TransData *td;
03794     TransData2D *td2d;
03795     Scene *scene= t->scene;
03796     double secf= FPS;
03797     int a;
03798 
03799     /* flush to 2d vector from internally used 3d vector */
03800     for (a=0, td= t->data, td2d=t->data2d; a<t->total; a++, td++, td2d++) {
03801         AnimData *adt= (AnimData *)td->extra; /* pointers to relevant AnimData blocks are stored in the td->extra pointers */
03802         
03803         /* handle snapping for time values
03804          *  - we should still be in NLA-mapping timespace
03805          *  - only apply to keyframes (but never to handles)
03806          */
03807         if ((td->flag & TD_NOTIMESNAP)==0) {
03808             switch (sipo->autosnap) {
03809                 case SACTSNAP_FRAME: /* snap to nearest frame (or second if drawing seconds) */
03810                     if (sipo->flag & SIPO_DRAWTIME)
03811                         td2d->loc[0]= (float)( floor((td2d->loc[0]/secf) + 0.5f) * secf );
03812                     else
03813                         td2d->loc[0]= (float)( floor(td2d->loc[0]+0.5f) );
03814                     break;
03815                 
03816                 case SACTSNAP_MARKER: /* snap to nearest marker */
03817                     td2d->loc[0]= (float)ED_markers_find_nearest_marker_time(&t->scene->markers, td2d->loc[0]);
03818                     break;
03819             }
03820         }
03821         
03822         /* we need to unapply the nla-mapping from the time in some situations */
03823         if (adt)
03824             td2d->loc2d[0]= BKE_nla_tweakedit_remap(adt, td2d->loc[0], NLATIME_CONVERT_UNMAP);
03825         else
03826             td2d->loc2d[0]= td2d->loc[0];
03827         
03828         /* if int-values only, truncate to integers */
03829         if (td->flag & TD_INTVALUES)
03830             td2d->loc2d[1]= floorf(td2d->loc[1] + 0.5f);
03831         else
03832             td2d->loc2d[1]= td2d->loc[1];
03833         
03834         if ((td->flag & TD_MOVEHANDLE1) && td2d->h1) {
03835             td2d->h1[0] = td2d->ih1[0] + td->loc[0] - td->iloc[0];
03836             td2d->h1[1] = td2d->ih1[1] + td->loc[1] - td->iloc[1];
03837         }
03838         
03839         if ((td->flag & TD_MOVEHANDLE2) && td2d->h2) {
03840             td2d->h2[0] = td2d->ih2[0] + td->loc[0] - td->iloc[0];
03841             td2d->h2[1] = td2d->ih2[1] + td->loc[1] - td->iloc[1];
03842         }
03843     }
03844 }
03845 
03846 /* ******************* Sequencer Transform data ******************* */
03847 
03848 /* This function applies the rules for transforming a strip so duplicate
03849  * checks don't need to be added in multiple places.
03850  *
03851  * recursive, count and flag MUST be set.
03852  *
03853  * seq->depth must be set before running this function so we know if the strips
03854  * are root level or not
03855  */
03856 static void SeqTransInfo(TransInfo *t, Sequence *seq, int *recursive, int *count, int *flag)
03857 {
03858     /* for extend we need to do some tricks */
03859     if (t->mode == TFM_TIME_EXTEND) {
03860 
03861         /* *** Extend Transform *** */
03862 
03863         Scene * scene= t->scene;
03864         int cfra= CFRA;
03865         int left= seq_tx_get_final_left(seq, 1);
03866         int right= seq_tx_get_final_right(seq, 1);
03867 
03868         if (seq->depth == 0 && ((seq->flag & SELECT) == 0 || (seq->flag & SEQ_LOCK))) {
03869             *recursive= 0;
03870             *count= 0;
03871             *flag= 0;
03872         }
03873         else if (seq->type ==SEQ_META) {
03874 
03875             /* for meta's we only ever need to extend their children, no matter what depth
03876              * just check the meta's are in the bounds */
03877             if (t->frame_side=='R' && right <= cfra)        *recursive= 0;
03878             else if (t->frame_side=='L' && left >= cfra)    *recursive= 0;
03879             else                                            *recursive= 1;
03880 
03881             *count= 1;
03882             *flag= (seq->flag | SELECT) & ~(SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
03883         }
03884         else {
03885 
03886             *recursive= 0;  /* not a meta, so no thinking here */
03887             *count= 1;      /* unless its set to 0, extend will never set 2 handles at once */
03888             *flag= (seq->flag | SELECT) & ~(SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
03889 
03890             if (t->frame_side=='R') {
03891                 if (right <= cfra)      *count= *flag= 0;   /* ignore */
03892                 else if (left > cfra)   ;   /* keep the selection */
03893                 else                    *flag |= SEQ_RIGHTSEL;
03894             }
03895             else {
03896                 if (left >= cfra)       *count= *flag= 0;   /* ignore */
03897                 else if (right < cfra)  ;   /* keep the selection */
03898                 else                    *flag |= SEQ_LEFTSEL;
03899             }
03900         }
03901     }
03902     else {
03903 
03904         t->frame_side= 'B';
03905 
03906         /* *** Normal Transform *** */
03907 
03908         if (seq->depth == 0) {
03909 
03910             /* Count */
03911 
03912             /* Non nested strips (resect selection and handles) */
03913             if ((seq->flag & SELECT) == 0 || (seq->flag & SEQ_LOCK)) {
03914                 *recursive= 0;
03915                 *count= 0;
03916                 *flag= 0;
03917             }
03918             else {
03919                 if ((seq->flag & (SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL)) == (SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL)) {
03920                     *flag= seq->flag;
03921                     *count= 2; /* we need 2 transdata's */
03922                 }
03923                 else {
03924                     *flag= seq->flag;
03925                     *count= 1; /* selected or with a handle selected */
03926                 }
03927 
03928                 /* Recursive */
03929 
03930                 if ((seq->type == SEQ_META) && ((seq->flag & (SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL)) == 0)) {
03931                     /* if any handles are selected, don't recurse */
03932                     *recursive = 1;
03933                 }
03934                 else {
03935                     *recursive = 0;
03936                 }
03937             }
03938         }
03939         else {
03940             /* Nested, different rules apply */
03941 
03942 #ifdef SEQ_TX_NESTED_METAS
03943             *flag= (seq->flag | SELECT) & ~(SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
03944             *count= 1; /* ignore the selection for nested */
03945             *recursive = (seq->type == SEQ_META );
03946 #else
03947             if (seq->type == SEQ_META) {
03948                 /* Meta's can only directly be moved between channels since they
03949                  * don't have their start and length set directly (children affect that)
03950                  * since this Meta is nested we don't need any of its data infact.
03951                  * calc_sequence() will update its settings when run on the toplevel meta */
03952                 *flag= 0;
03953                 *count= 0;
03954                 *recursive = 1;
03955             }
03956             else {
03957                 *flag= (seq->flag | SELECT) & ~(SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
03958                 *count= 1; /* ignore the selection for nested */
03959                 *recursive = 0;
03960             }
03961 #endif
03962         }
03963     }
03964 }
03965 
03966 
03967 
03968 static int SeqTransCount(TransInfo *t, Sequence *parent, ListBase *seqbase, int depth)
03969 {
03970     Sequence *seq;
03971     int tot= 0, recursive, count, flag;
03972 
03973     for (seq= seqbase->first; seq; seq= seq->next) {
03974         seq->depth= depth;
03975 
03976         /* seq->tmp is used by seq_tx_get_final_{left,right} to check sequence's range and clamp to it if needed.
03977          * it's first place where digging into sequences tree, so store link to parent here */
03978         seq->tmp = parent;
03979 
03980         SeqTransInfo(t, seq, &recursive, &count, &flag); /* ignore the flag */
03981         tot += count;
03982 
03983         if (recursive) {
03984             tot += SeqTransCount(t, seq, &seq->seqbase, depth+1);
03985         }
03986     }
03987 
03988     return tot;
03989 }
03990 
03991 
03992 static TransData *SeqToTransData(TransData *td, TransData2D *td2d, TransDataSeq *tdsq, Sequence *seq, int flag, int sel_flag)
03993 {
03994     int start_left;
03995 
03996     switch(sel_flag) {
03997     case SELECT:
03998         /* Use seq_tx_get_final_left() and an offset here
03999          * so transform has the left hand location of the strip.
04000          * tdsq->start_offset is used when flushing the tx data back */
04001         start_left= seq_tx_get_final_left(seq, 0);
04002         td2d->loc[0]= start_left;
04003         tdsq->start_offset= start_left - seq->start; /* use to apply the original location */
04004         break;
04005     case SEQ_LEFTSEL:
04006         start_left= seq_tx_get_final_left(seq, 0);
04007         td2d->loc[0] = start_left;
04008         break;
04009     case SEQ_RIGHTSEL:
04010         td2d->loc[0] = seq_tx_get_final_right(seq, 0);
04011         break;
04012     }
04013 
04014     td2d->loc[1] = seq->machine; /* channel - Y location */
04015     td2d->loc[2] = 0.0f;
04016     td2d->loc2d = NULL;
04017 
04018 
04019     tdsq->seq= seq;
04020 
04021     /* Use instead of seq->flag for nested strips and other
04022      * cases where the selection may need to be modified */
04023     tdsq->flag= flag;
04024     tdsq->sel_flag= sel_flag;
04025 
04026 
04027     td->extra= (void *)tdsq; /* allow us to update the strip from here */
04028 
04029     td->flag = 0;
04030     td->loc = td2d->loc;
04031     copy_v3_v3(td->center, td->loc);
04032     copy_v3_v3(td->iloc, td->loc);
04033 
04034     memset(td->axismtx, 0, sizeof(td->axismtx));
04035     td->axismtx[2][2] = 1.0f;
04036 
04037     td->ext= NULL; td->val= NULL;
04038 
04039     td->flag |= TD_SELECTED;
04040     td->dist= 0.0;
04041 
04042     unit_m3(td->mtx);
04043     unit_m3(td->smtx);
04044 
04045     /* Time Transform (extend) */
04046     td->val= td2d->loc;
04047     td->ival= td2d->loc[0];
04048 
04049     return td;
04050 }
04051 
04052 static int SeqToTransData_Recursive(TransInfo *t, ListBase *seqbase, TransData *td, TransData2D *td2d, TransDataSeq *tdsq)
04053 {
04054     Sequence *seq;
04055     int recursive, count, flag;
04056     int tot= 0;
04057 
04058     for (seq= seqbase->first; seq; seq= seq->next) {
04059 
04060         SeqTransInfo(t, seq, &recursive, &count, &flag);
04061 
04062         /* add children first so recalculating metastrips does nested strips first */
04063         if (recursive) {
04064             int tot_children= SeqToTransData_Recursive(t, &seq->seqbase, td, td2d, tdsq);
04065 
04066             td=     td +    tot_children;
04067             td2d=   td2d +  tot_children;
04068             tdsq=   tdsq +  tot_children;
04069 
04070             tot += tot_children;
04071         }
04072 
04073         /* use 'flag' which is derived from seq->flag but modified for special cases */
04074         if (flag & SELECT) {
04075             if (flag & (SEQ_LEFTSEL|SEQ_RIGHTSEL)) {
04076                 if (flag & SEQ_LEFTSEL) {
04077                     SeqToTransData(td++, td2d++, tdsq++, seq, flag, SEQ_LEFTSEL);
04078                     tot++;
04079                 }
04080                 if (flag & SEQ_RIGHTSEL) {
04081                     SeqToTransData(td++, td2d++, tdsq++, seq, flag, SEQ_RIGHTSEL);
04082                     tot++;
04083                 }
04084             }
04085             else {
04086                 SeqToTransData(td++, td2d++, tdsq++, seq, flag, SELECT);
04087                 tot++;
04088             }
04089         }
04090     }
04091 
04092     return tot;
04093 }
04094 
04095 static void freeSeqData(TransInfo *t)
04096 {
